title: Senior Account Director, Toys & Entertainment
content:
The Overview:
Are you a creative individual who is passionate about developing and implementing integrated PR strategies that utilize the full scope of the communications mix, including media relations, influencer outreach and events?
Do you have a passion for pop culture and digital entertainment?  R&CPMK is seeking a Senior Account Director to play an important role for a leading toy and game company account and a major entertainment platform.
We’re looking for someone with an expertise and passion within the consumer and digital lifestyle space. In this role, you’ll have a seat at the table, crafting national strategy and programs with an integrated marketing team. The ideal candidate should understand the importance of entertaining and connecting generations of fans through the wonder of storytelling and exhilaration of play.
As a leader, you recognize that excellent client service is the key to our success and that drives your daily interactions. You enjoy leading and developing an account team, helping to craft the skills of rising stars.
The Fine Print:

Implement programs that resonate with diverse consumer segments
Deliver thoughtful and creative programming that resonates with major lifestyle, entertainment and general consumer media
Advise on story angles to elevate brand positioning
Lead and develop engaged and diverse teams; serve as an important mentor to mid- and junior-level team members, fostering respect and collaboration within the team
Manage multiple projects seamlessly; encourage effective delegation of project results
Assess program efficiency ensuring ROI and efficient use of client budget
Accountable for quality control and review of all planning decks, recaps, status reports, work back schedules, and overall project management

The Needs:

8+ years of relevant work experience; agency experience in consumer category is a requirement
Proven experience running day-to-day client service and project management of large, multi-channel brands with a wide range of internal and external partners
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and prioritize most urgent client needs
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel/SharePoint/Google Sheets and ability to build processes/organize data for client outputs
Experience engaging with mid-to senior-level clients
Outstanding judgment when working with diverse media outlets, team members, client contacts, and vendors
Very organized with unfailing attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal skills with the ability to craft solid plans

Why Us:
R&CPMK is the original entertainment and culture agency! Our purpose is to drive cultural relevance & engagement for talent, brands, and content creators. Our vision is to inspire communities through cultural connection. Our Values: Be Human, Be Purposeful, Lead with Passion, Be Open Minded, Be Connected.
Our people’s well-being is one of our highest priorities! A 1pm finish on Fridays, flexible paid time off, and our Body, Mind, Soul program are here to help us all balance our busy lives.
We are a sociable bunch, we make sure we find lots of excuses to come together both virtually and in person through our many company events, hosted by our social committee and employee resource groups.
To support your career development, we have a wealth of internal and external learning opportunities. Tuition reimbursement is also available for those that are interested in continued education.
It is not just about living in the here and now, so we also help you plan for your future with a 401k, a stock purchase plan, generous paid family leave, fertility, and adoption benefits.
With offices in Los Angeles, New York, and London, R&CPMK is part of the Octagon Sports and Entertainment Network.
Salary: $100,000.00- $120,000.00 annually
Where an employee or prospective employee is paid within this range will depend on, among other factors, actual ranges for current/former employees in the subject position; market considerations; budgetary considerations; tenure and standing with the company (applicable to current employees); as well as the employee’s/applicant’s background, pertinent experience, and qualifications.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.We make our careers website accessible to any and all users. If you need an accommodation to participate in the application process, please contact us at JobAppAccommodation@ipgdxtra.com. This email address is not for general employment inquiries or vendors; rather it is strictly for applicants who require special assistance accessing our employment website. Due to volume, messages sent to this email address that are not related to an accommodation cannot be answered.

Our Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As such, we ask all applicants to provide the information listed below. You are NOT required to provide this information. To enable us to meet government reporting regulations, we request that you complete this personal data form. Information will be used for government reporting purposes and will be detached and kept separate from your application. Any information that you choose to provide will not be considered by the Company for employment purposes and will be treated as personal and confidential. Your voluntary cooperation will be appreciated.

Veteran Status

The following information is requested in order to fulfill statistical reporting and monitoring requirements. If you are a protected veteran, as noted below, you are asked to self-identify your US military veteran status. This information is voluntary and will be kept confidential as required under applicable federal and state law.

Definitions:

1. Disabled veteran - A veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or

- A person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability.

2. Recently separated veteran — Any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service.

3. Armed Forces service medal veteran — A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.

4. Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran — A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized, under the laws administered by the Department of Defense.
